Thank you, as always, for trusting NASCO to be your partner of choice for insurance and risk management advisory.

Please allow me to update you on the current status and progress achieved in the renewal of Chalhoub Group’s General Insurance program:

 

1.	As per Hagop’s request, we approached GIG to extend the current policies for two months. Unfortunately, GIG declined unless Chalhoub Group settled at least 75% of the outstanding premiums (see attached).
2.	In light of GIG’s lack of cooperation—both on the extension request and in providing claims experience for the past three years — we took the initiative to secure alternative solutions.
3.	I am pleased to inform you that we have successfully concluded the RFQ process ahead of the expiry date (please refer to the attached).
4.	Given the limited time available expiry after two days, I strongly recommend providing us with the firm order / purchase order at the earliest to avoid any gap in coverage, which could expose Chalhoub Group’s business in KSA to risk.

 

While Al Rajhi Takaful submitted the lowest quotations, their proposal is non-binding, meaning it can be altered at any time.

 

Conclusion: Based on the most competitive binding terms and conditions, we recommend proceeding with TAWUNIYA, a market leader in KSA and one of the largest insurers in the Middle East.

 

Best Regards

 

Eng. Mazen Almazni – Cert CII

 

Head of General Insurance

 



 

Nasco Saudi Arabia 

Real Building, 3rd Floor, Muhammad Marakshi Street, Az Zahra Dist,
3705 Jeddah 23424-6269, KSA

T    800 244 0365

D  +966 12 213 9223

Thank you, as always, for trusting NASCO to be your partner of choice for insurance and risk management advisory.

Please allow me to update you on the current status and progress achieved in the renewal of Chalhoub Group’s General Insurance program:

 

1.	As per Hagop’s request, we approached GIG to extend the current policies for two months. Unfortunately, GIG declined unless Chalhoub Group settled at least 75% of the outstanding premiums (see attached).
2.	In light of GIG’s lack of cooperation—both on the extension request and in providing claims experience for the past three years — we took the initiative to secure alternative solutions.
3.	I am pleased to inform you that we have successfully concluded the RFQ process ahead of the expiry date (please refer to the attached).
4.	Given the limited time available expiry after two days, I strongly recommend providing us with the firm order / purchase order at the earliest to avoid any gap in coverage, which could expose Chalhoub Group’s business in KSA to risk.

 

While Al Rajhi Takaful submitted the lowest quotations, their proposal is non-binding, meaning it can be altered at any time.

 

Conclusion: Based on the most competitive binding terms and conditions, we recommend proceeding with TAWUNIYA, a market leader in KSA and one of the largest insurers in the Middle East.

 

Best Regards

 

Eng. Mazen Almazni – Cert CII

 

Head of General Insurance

Thank you, as always, for trusting NASCO to be your partner of choice for insurance and risk management advisory.

Please allow me to update you on the current status and progress achieved in the renewal of Chalhoub Group’s General Insurance program:

 

1.	As per Hagop’s request, we approached GIG to extend the current policies for two months. Unfortunately, GIG declined unless Chalhoub Group settled at least 75% of the outstanding premiums (see attached).
2.	In light of GIG’s lack of cooperation—both on the extension request and in providing claims experience for the past three years — we took the initiative to secure alternative solutions.
3.	I am pleased to inform you that we have successfully concluded the RFQ process ahead of the expiry date (please refer to the attached).
4.	Given the limited time available expiry after two days, I strongly recommend providing us with the firm order / purchase order at the earliest to avoid any gap in coverage, which could expose Chalhoub Group’s business in KSA to risk.

 

While Al Rajhi Takaful submitted the lowest quotations, their proposal is non-binding, meaning it can be altered at any time.

 

Conclusion: Based on the most competitive binding terms and conditions, we recommend proceeding with TAWUNIYA, a market leader in KSA and one of the largest insurers in the Middle East.

 

Best Regards

 

Eng. Mazen Almazni – Cert CII

 

Head of General Insurance

 



 

Nasco Saudi Arabia

Real Building, 3rd Floor, Muhammad Marakshi Street, Az Zahra Dist,
3705 Jeddah 23424-6269, KSA

T    800 244 0365

D  +966 12 213 9223

Thank you, as always, for trusting NASCO to be your partner of choice for insurance and risk management advisory.

Please allow me to update you on the current status and progress achieved in the renewal of Chalhoub Group’s General Insurance program:

 

1.	As per Hagop’s request, we approached GIG to extend the current policies for two months. Unfortunately, GIG declined unless Chalhoub Group settled at least 75% of the outstanding premiums (see attached).
2.	In light of GIG’s lack of cooperation—both on the extension request and in providing claims experience for the past three years — we took the initiative to secure alternative solutions.
3.	I am pleased to inform you that we have successfully concluded the RFQ process ahead of the expiry date (please refer to the attached).
4.	Given the limited time available expiry after two days, I strongly recommend providing us with the firm order / purchase order at the earliest to avoid any gap in coverage, which could expose Chalhoub Group’s business in KSA to risk.

 

While Al Rajhi Takaful submitted the lowest quotations, their proposal is non-binding, meaning it can be altered at any time.

 

Conclusion: Based on the most competitive binding terms and conditions, we recommend proceeding with TAWUNIYA, a market leader in KSA and one of the largest insurers in the Middle East.

 

Best Regards

 

Eng. Mazen Almazni – Cert CII

 

Head of General Insurance

 



 

Nasco Saudi Arabia

Real Building, 3rd Floor, Muhammad Marakshi Street, Az Zahra Dist,
3705 Jeddah 23424-6269, KSA

T    800 244 0365

D  +966 12 213 9223
